events.message: The insured reported a vehicle collision on April 30 resulting in damage to the front bumper and hood.
Claim was categorized under Auto Accident as the primary damage involved a car collision.
An agent was assigned to handle the claim specifically for the auto accident involving the insured's vehicle.
The claim acknowledgement was sent to the customer confirming receipt and next steps for their car accident damage.
The customer was asked to submit a police report, photos of vehicle damage, and repair estimates related to the accident.
The insured promptly submitted all requested documents including police report and detailed damage photos.
An investigation into the circumstances of the vehicle collision was initiated to verify claim validity and extent.
The investigation confirmed the accident details and damage assessments as reported by the insured.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the cost of vehicle repairs and related expenses for the auto accident.
The insured responded with positive feedback, expressing satisfaction with the claim process and settlement offer.
The claim was officially approved for payment following customer acceptance of the settlement proposal.
Payment was issued to the insured to cover the vehicle repair costs resulting from the auto collision.
The claim was closed successfully after payment issuance with all prescribed procedures duly completed.
